page.title: 15SCOUTING IN BRECHIN
page.content: After 75 years of scouting in Brechin the scout hall in Bank Street suffers badly from both wet and dry rot.Recently a new site has been found for a new hall in Damacre Road. Building plans have been drawn up and 75% of the total cost of Â£24000 has been raised through grants and the present scouts are trying to raise the rest of the funds. A few years ago the group was expanded to include a Beaver colony of 24 and a Venture unit of 12. The Scout troop has 27 members and there are Cub packs of 36 and 27. Each section has its individual programmes, leaders, activities and meetings which are held once a week. The whole group sometimes combine for special occasions such as camps in the Angus Glens or day visits to Ice Rinks, Airports, Army Barracks and Observatories.
